citeinfo.title: Fire Island National Seashore, Field Plots Data Base for Vegetation Mappings

descript.abstract: This dataset was compiled to provide users with the geographic locations of the vegetation plots used to create the Fire Island Vegetation Map classification system.
descript.purpose: The purpose of this data is to provide the managers and researchers on Fire Island with an accurate spatially referenced dataset to assist in their efforts.

spdom.descgeog: Fire Island National Seashore and on the West by the Robert Moses State Park and on the East by the Smith Point County Park.

idinfo.accconst: There are no access constraints attached to these data.
idinfo.useconst: These data were designed to identify and map vegetation polygons only. They are not appropriate for other uses such as legal property boundary identification, tax assessment, etc.

browse.browsed: 103 Kbyte, locations of vegetation plot samples; low resolution for web browsing.

attracc.attraccr: Data and locations were collected on a GPS and differentially corrected. The vegetation values collected were largely qualitative and based on the experience of the observer. These data were only used as a guide for the photointerpreter to assign vegetation associations from the photography.

dataqual.logic: Points were created from GPS data recorded in the field.
dataqual.complete: All vegetation plots conducted as part of the Fire Island Vegetation Mapping Project are included as are some plots from previous NYNHP work in the area.

horizpa.horizpar: Location information was taken with a GPS and differentially corrected. No quantitative report of accuracy is available, but subsequent field visits to these same points indicate that accuracy is within 5 m at most locations.

procstep.procdesc: These data were taken as locations with attributes in the field. The points were differentially corrected and imported to the GIS. The vegetation information along with the point location were used to guide assignment of delineated polygons to vegetation associations.

enttyp.enttypd: Field plots data base information at various spots on the entire length of Fire Island. These attributes included species, height, and estimates of percent cover for a particular polygon. Plots were georeferenced to within 5 m using GPS unit and differentially corrected.
enttyp.enttypds: The plot sampling methodology used by the NYNHP on Fire Island follow the methodology developed by The Nature Conservancy and the network of Natural Heritage Programs (Sneddon 1994, Grossman et al. 1998, Edinger et al. 2000).

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Area is always zero for point coverages. Values are automatically generated.

codesetd.codesetn: New York Natural Heritage Program Vegetation Classification Codeset

attrdomv.udom: Perimeter is always zero for point coverages. Values are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: final association classification the plot represents

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

cntorgp.cntorg: USGS Biological Resources Division, Center for Biological Informatics

distinfo.resdesc: NPS Vegetation Mapping Program: Vegetation Map of Fire Island National Seashore
distinfo.distliab: The distributor maintains no liability for the use and application of these data beyond it's intended use as a depiction of vegetation.

cntaddr.address: U.S. Geological Survey, Center for Biological Informatics, MS 302, Room 8000, Building 810, Denver Federal Center

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC-STD-001.1-1999 Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata, 1998 Part 1: Biological Data Profile, 1999
